thread.title: Maharashtra 2017 civic polls results LIVE: Counting begins, BJP clinches first few seats- The New Indian Express
thread.title_full: Maharashtra 2017 civic polls results LIVE: Counting begins, BJP clinches first few seats- The New Indian Express

title: Maharashtra 2017 civic polls results LIVE: Counting begins, BJP clinches first few seats- The New Indian Express
text:
ABS: 1 Independent: 4 
6:55 pm: BJP's Atul Shah won ward no. 220 of BMC after lottery in presence of Municipal Commissioner. - ANI (READ MORE) 
6:35 pm: Shiv Sena has done better in these elections, even Muslim voters have turned towards Shiv Sena: Uddhav Thackeray. - ANI (READ MORE) 
5:50 pm: Won't accept Pankaja Munde's resignation. In elections, it happens that we lose and win: CM Devendra Fadnavis. - TV reports 
5:45 pm: This huge victory for BJP is on the agenda of transparency. BJP has won the trust of the people. There's a tie for No. 1 spot. I thank people of Maharashtra. We've won nearly 81 seats, earlier we had 31. It shows the wide support for our agenda of transparency: CM Devendra Fadnavis. - ANI and TV reports (READ MORE) 
5:40 pm: Mumbai has proved that they are with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. From 31 seats last year, we have 82 seats today: Piyush Goyal of BJP. -ANI 
5:35 pm: Felicitation after BJP's performance in local body polls, Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis to address a press conference shortly. -ANI 
5:30 pm: Prakash Javadekar's reaction to the Maharashtra verdict. (READ MORE) Maharashtra verdict gives clear indication of India becoming free of Congress: Prakash Javdekar @NewIndianXpress â€” Manish Anand (@AnandM25_TNIE) February 23, 2017 
5:20 pm: BJP's Atul Shah and Shiv Sena's Surendra Bagalkar in a tie after recounting in South Mumbai. 
5:15 pm: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis wants BJP and Shiv Sena to come together, says Finance Minister Sudhir Mungantiwar. 
5:00 pm: Maharashtra chief minister Devendra Fadnavis felicitated by supporters for BJP's performance in local body polls. ANI 
4:55 pm: State overall tally for all municipal corporations till 4 PM: BJP: 470
